clues.text: Fittingly, the final episode of this CBS sitcom found Max & Caroline without a penny to their names
This HBO series about the Fisher family put the "fun" in funeral home
The reboot of this sitcom features a Cuban-American family & Gloria Estefan giving a Latin flair to its theme "This is It"
Imported from Britain, "Man About the House" became this sitcom that starred John Ritter
Scott Wolf & Matthew Fox were 2 of the orphaned siblings on this '90s FOX drama

rounds.comments: (Alex: Those are words that are spelled the same but pronounced differently, and we want both pronunciations in each correct response.)

clues.text: To lead the orchestra & your deportment
Majestic & a month of the year
To allow an event to occur & the city document allowing an event to occur
To let go from class & an explanation for one's mistake
To coalesce & a grain-harvesting machine

Eyeglasses with 3 different vision powers built in for close-up, middle & distant viewing
A style of metal-rimmed circular glasses is named after this rock musician
10-letter adjective for sunglasses that curve to also cover & protect your eyes from the side

This "Beehive State" keeps busy with the USA's highest birth rate
John Kerry summers there, sometimes on Naushon Island
The Oswego Canal is part of its 500-mile canal system
4 of its last 10 governors have spent time in federal prison

This song by Seal was the big hit from the "Batman Forever" soundtrack
This Celtics point guard plays the title character in "Uncle Drew" & performs "Ridiculous" on its soundtrack
This director of 1978's "Halloween" adapted the film's iconic theme song for the 2018 sequel with son Cody
The soundtrack for this 2017 Hugh Jackman movie was in the top 10 for more than 30 weeks
From 1821 until 1848 this country controlled what is today California
In November 1620 this document was signed onboard a ship off Cape Cod
In 1925 John T. Scopes was put on trial, convicted & fined for teaching evolution in this Southern state
In 1792 Congress tried to increase judges' workload, leading to the 1st federal court decision voiding a law on this basis

"___ corrupts, and absolute ___ corrupts absolutely"
Per Shakespeare, "what's past is ___"
This word meaning to recede often precedes "& flow"
Time Out New York says Russ & Daughters is one of the best places to get bagels & this
1992 is the OED's first citation for this word meaning so-so; it described "Melrose Place"
Doing this type of lively dance is synonymous with elation
This red, brimless cap is also called a tarboosh
Nat Turner led a slave rebellion in 1831, around the time that this Polish composer made his way to Paris
Burton & Speke visited Lake Tanganyika in 1858, when these 2 were running for U.S. Senator & debated each other 7 times

1733 saw the start of the war of Polish Succession; that same year this man founded Savannah, Georgia

rounds.comments: (Alex: Tell us what show is just starting when you hear the opening lines from that show.)

clues.text: "In the huge metropolis of Gotham City, who knows when, where or how a warped criminal mind will strike"
"In the criminal justice system, the people are represented by 2 separate yet equally important groups"
"Meet the Robertson clan... running a family business is tough when the family just wants to run wild"
"4 chefs, 3 courses, only one chance to win"
"There is nothing wrong with your television set.  Do not attempt to adjust the picture.  We are controlling transmission"
A novel about a bestseller on UFOs, or a Will Smith movie about policing extraterrestrials
In "The Name of the Rose", it is revealed that the murders are related to this Greek's "Poetics"
Signaling ancient secrets, a book magically appears at this Univ.'s Bodleian Library in "A Discovery of Witches"
In Azar Nafisi's bestseller, a group of students are secretly "Reading Lolita in" this Middle Eastern capital city
In a novel, Juliet Ashton finds the subject of her next book: this island's "Literary & Potato Peel Pie Society"
